ECClass.description: Keeps the localizable values from this element from being combined with those from another element if duplication occurs. If combined a GUID is used as the key for the localizable value.

ECProperty.description: If true the elements Display Label will always be treated as a unique value.
If true the elements description will always be treated as a unique value.

ECClass.description: For Internal Use Only. Applied to a custom attribute class defiition to indicate which string properties refer to a property in the class where this attribute is applied.

ECArrayProperty.description: A list of properties whose values are references to a property in the class where this attribute is applied.

ECClass.description: Business Key Specification

ECProperty.description: Name of Property to use for displaying ECBusinessKey.StringValue

ECClass.description: See Bentley.ECObjects.Standards.CalculatedECPropertySpecification. ECCustomAttributeClass for specifying an ECExpression to be used for calculating the value of a given ECProperty.

ECProperty.description: The ECExpression used to calculate an ECProperty's value.
The string representation of the value to use when the value cannot be calculated due to missing dependents or any other reason.

Will be used when converting from the property value back into its constituent properties. This may be null, and is mostly applicable when the expression has been used to concatenate multiple other property values.
Indicates that the value will only be calculated once on the initial get.
ECProperty.displayLabel: Is calculated as default value only

ECProperty.description: Indicates that if the CalculatedECProperty fails to calculate, then use the last valid value.
ECProperty.displayLabel: Use the last valid value on failure

ECProperty.description: Indicates whether ECMAScript should be used when evaluating the parser regular expression. Default value for this property is false, meaning that ECMAScript will be used. Set this to true when using Unicode.

ECArrayProperty.description: ECExpressions SymbolSets required for evaluation of the ECExpression

ECProperty.description: By default when evaluating ECExpressions, IECPropertyValueFormatter::ConvertTo/FromExpressionType() is invoked to convert the stored value to the type it should have in ECExpressions, or vice-versa. For example, distances stored in UORs are converted from UORs to master units, and radians are converted to degrees. If SuppressTypeConversions is set to true, these conversions will not be performed

By default when evaluating ECExpressions, linear units are converted to dimensioned meters and units are otherwise ignored. Set this property to true to enforce unit checking and unit conversions in arithmetic, comparison, and assignment operations. Setting this option implicitly also sets SuppressTypeConversions.

ECClass.description: Defines change management features for this ECClass

ECProperty.description: If true then change management is supported for this ECClass

ECClass.description: For Internal Use Only. Applied to a custom attribute class definition to indicate which string properties refer to a class in the schema where the custom attribute class is applied.

ECArrayProperty.description: A list of properties whose values are references to a class. All classes must be in the current schema.

ECClass.description: Identifies a struct that should have a custom XML string generated

ECProperty.description: SerializerName Name

ECClass.description: Specifies how relationships should be persisted.

ECProperty.description: Defines on which end relationship should be persisted.
Defines whether single ended relationships should be traversable in both directions (default is false). Bidirectional traversal is not supported by 8.11.7 or initial release of DgnActiveXControl.

Defines whether we persist a pointer on the other end in case of a single ended relationship when bothe ends are in the same file but in different model (default is false). This is required in case we want to be able to traverse in the reverse direction even when the source model is not loaded. Having the backpointer allows loading the source model.
Defines whether LocalKey is persisted as a ECXA:n string or as a [ProviderId,XAttributeId] integers pair.

ECClass.description: See Bentley.ECObjects.Standards.DGNPersistedGeometry. ECCustomAttributeClass for specifying that an IGeometry ECProperty is to be translated to DGN geometry when the instance is written to a DGN file with the default persistence strategy of the DgnECPlugin

ECProperty.description: The name of the IGeometry ECProperty of this ECClass that is to be translated to DGN geometry when the instance is written to a DGN file with the default persistence strategy of the DgnECPlugin

ECClass.description: Global ID Specification

ECProperty.description: Name of Property to use for displaying GlobalId.StringValue

ECClass.description: Specifies which ECProperty to use for the InstanceLabel for tree nodes and other GUI

ECProperty.description: Name of ECProperty to use for the InstanceLabel for tree nodes and other GUI

ECClass.description: Specifies that the display label of the ECClass is always used as the InstanceLabel for instances of that class. This is used to override the default behavior when no InstanceLabelSpecification exists, which is to use the value of any property called Name or NAME as the instance label. If both an ClassLabelIsInstanceLabel and InstanceLabelSpecification custom attribute exist on the same ECClass, the InstanceLabelSpecification is used.

ValueMap.DisplayString: Natural alpha-numeric sorting by the instance label.
Natural alpha-numeric sorting by a specified property

ECClass.description: ISO 15926 metadata back reference

ECProperty.description: ISO 15926 Part2 Entity Type (e.g. http://dm.rdlfacade.org/data#ClassOfInanimatePhysicalObject)
POSC Caesar Association Identifier
POSC Caesar Association Alternate Designation
POSC Caesar Association Creation Date
POSC Caesar Association Submitting Organization
POSC Caesar Association Creator
POSC Caesar Association Registration Status
POSC Caesar Association Note
POSC Caesar Association Note Example

ECClass.description: Contains a localized value and a key that identifies it. The key may be a GUID or the original value. If the value is a GUID 'IsGUID' is true.
Specifies the locale and an array of resources consisting of key-value pairs that contain localization data.
For Schema Evolution. Holds a previous name for an element, the last released version when this name was used and if the current element should be saved on rename.

ECProperty.description: The previous name of the renamed element
The value of the SchemaChangeTrackingState.SchemaFullNameAtEditingStart property at the time the 'OldName' was recorded
The date and time the the 'OldName' was recorded
If true this element was added in this version so no new tracking information needs to be saved.

ECClass.description: For Schema Evolution. Holds previous name entries for the current element.

ECProperty.description: If true a PreviousName entry has already been saved for this version of the schema. If false a PreviousName should be saved on rename.

ECClass.description: Defined at the top level of a schema to indicate that this schema may have supplemental schemas

ECProperty.description: True if this primary schema contains units data

ECClass.description: When applied to a property it allows type changes requiring a transformation to pass through Schema Evolution and transformations using an ECExpression for any property transform.

ECProperty.description: When set this is used to parse the source data into named groups, each named group can be accessed by the Transformation ECExpression.
When set this ECExpression will be used for the transformation rather than trying to use a builtin transformation.

ECArrayProperty.description: ECExpressions SymbolSets required for evaluation of the ECExpression

ECClass.description: Custom attribute showing that the relationship is of reference type. This means that the relationship is just reference, but not an object. IDs for such relationship are not meaningful.
A specification of related items to display with the parent

ECProperty.description: Parent class the related items should be visible on
Relationship path to the related items

ECArrayProperty.description: List of derived classes for polymorphic relationship

ECClass.description: Allows the display of related item's properties with the current parent

ECProperty.description: Schema full name used as a key for all edits in this version

ECClass.description: Holds some important change tracking information about a schema.

ECProperty.description: If true the schema has been prepared for release. To edit the schema again before release the finalization needs to be backed out. Nothing needs to be done to edit for a new release.
The schema full name when editing for a new version is started
If true change tracking attributes will be added, if false they will not.

ECArrayProperty.description: An array containing the history of finalizations.

ECClass.description: Custom Attribute Class that is applied to a supplemental schema

ECProperty.description: The name of the schema that this schema supplements
The major version number of the primary schema
The minor version number of the primary schema

Integer precedence of this supplemental schema. Lower Precedence than primary (Universal:0-99, Industrial:100-199). Higher Precedence than primary (Speciality:200-299, Company:300-399, Department:400-499, Project:500-599).
A string representing the function of this supplemental schema.
If true this schema is specific to a user.

ECClass.description: Custom attribute that indicates if a relationship class supports ordered relationships.
Custom attribute that indicates if a relationship constraint supports ordered relationships.
Custom attribute that indicates if a relationship source or target supports associated string.
Custom attribute that indicates if a relationship class supports storing properties.
Custom attribute that points on property that should be used as synchronization ID

ECProperty.description: Name of property
Back color of the node
Fore Color of the Node
The unique name of the current Map.

ECClass.description: Optional additional meta data for ECProperties of type DateTime.

ECProperty.description: Either Utc, Local or Unspecified. Default: Unspecified. When specifying a DateTimeKind, it is usually not necessary to specify a DateTimeComponent because a DateTimeKind implies the DateTimeComponent 'DateTime'.
Either DateTime or Date. Default: DateTime. Specifying 'Date' usually implies that a DateTimeKind is irrelevant, because dates (without time) don't need any timezone information.

ECClass.description: DEPRECATED: Use ECDbMap ECSchema instead

ECProperty.description: The prefix should be 2-4 letters followed by an underbar, e.g. plnt_.
Optional and can have one possible value DoNotMap.
Optional and can have two possible values. 1. DoNotMap 2. TableForThisClass

ECClass.description: DEPRECATED: Use ECDbMap ECSchema instead

ECProperty.description: If not specified, the ECProperty name is used. It must follow EC Identifier specification.

Applicable to arrays and struct type properties. Value can be 'StoreInSeparateTable' or 'Blob'. By default primitive arrays are stored as blob and struct and struct arrays are stored in separate table.
Might not be honorable when multiple ECClasses are stored in a single table
Only allow unique values for this column.

Specify how string compare should work for this property. Options 1) BINARY(default): bit to bit matching. 2). NOCASE: The same as binary, except the 26 upper case characters of ASCII are folded to their lower case equivalents before the comparison is performed. Note that is folds only ASCII not full UTF. 3) RTRIM: The same as binary, except that trailing space characters are ignored.
Only applied to ECDouble type properties. Possible value are 0-16

ECClass.description: DEPRECATED: Use ECDbMap ECSchema instead

ECProperty.description: Optional name of the index. Follow EC identifier rules. It need to be globally unique in database. Two index with same name will cause error.
Optional unique constraint. Default value is false. All keys in index must be unique

ECArrayProperty.description: List of properties that will be part of index. Only primitive type properties can be added to this array.

ECProperty.description: Where constraint of Index

ECClass.description: Specify database forign key constraint.

ECProperty.description: This enable referential integerity. Default is 'false'.
Optional and only used if 'EnforceReferentialIntegrityCheck=True'. Possiable values are 'NoAction' (default) and 'Cascade' which delete child rows when parent row is deleted.
Optional and only used if 'EnforceReferentialIntegrityCheck=True'. Possiable values are 'NoAction' (default) and 'Cascade' which update child forign key when parent primary key is updated.
Optional default value is 'Full'. This is reserved for future use.

ECClass.description: Optional hint to tell how to map relationship constraint

ECProperty.description: User provided target ECClassId column name.
User provided target ECInstanceId column name.
Optional and default value is true. This create default index on relationship. User can disable it if needed.

ECStructProperty.description: Describe if and how to apply foreign key constraint. It is only applicable to 'Embedding' or 'Referencing' type relationships. The relationship mush have only one table at each end for this to work.

ECClass.description: DEPRECATED: Use ECDbMap ECSchema instead

ECProperty.description: Optional hints regarding how the ECClass is mapped to table(s). Possible values are DoNotMap, DoNotMapHierarchy, TablePerHierarchy, TableForThisClass, TablePerClass, RelationshipSourceTable and RelationshipTargetTable
Optionally specify custom 'primary key' column which must be a Int64.
Optionally provide user define table name for this class
Optionally provide if table already exist or will be created automatically. Default value is 'False'
Optionally provide if table can be replaced by a readonly null view if table is empty. This can happen if target dgndb is only used as readonly after publishing

ECArrayProperty.description: Optional list of indexes on properties of this class. It can be use to improve query performance or to add unique constraint.

ECProperty.description: If instance of class with this custom attribute is found on a Named Group, then convert the Named Group to an assembly.

ECClass.description: Optional hint to provide indexing information to optimize relationship querying.

ECProperty.description: Specify preferred direction for N:N and 1:1 relationships as a hint to optimize queries in that direction. Possible values: SourceToTarget: Querying target rows for a source row should be optimized. TargetToSource: Querying source rows for a target row should be optimized. Bidirectional: no preferred query direction.
By default relationship need to be unique. The property can be set to override it and allow dupplicate values
User provided source ECInstanceId column name (deprecated use ECDbRelationshipConstraintHint.ECIdColumn)
User provided source ECClassId column name (deprecated use ECDbRelationshipConstraintHint.ECClassIdColumn)
User provided target ECClassId column name (deprecated use ECDbRelationshipConstraintHint.ECClassIdColumn)
User provided target ECInstanceId column name (deprecated use ECDbRelationshipConstraintHint.ECIdColumn)

ECClass.description: ECSchema level attribute that mark schema as dynamic. A Dynamic schema is generated by applications.
ECSchema level attribute that mark schema as system schema. A system schema is internal to application or product for managing and storing its internal data.
Applied to any ECClass to indicate that if instances of the class are persisted in ECD format, all strings in the ECD buffer should be persisted as Utf-8
Helper class for the SupplementalProvenance custom attribute. Used to define a supplemental schema and its purpose

ECProperty.description: Name of the supplemental schema
Purpose of the supplemental schema

ECClass.description: Provenance defining what supplemental schemas were used to create a compiled, supplemented schema

ECArrayProperty.description: List of all supplemental schemas that were used to supplement this schema

ECClass.description: ECClass level attribute used to specify search options for a class.
Indicates that the direction of the ECRelationship is meaningless. For example, a relationship that relates two ECInstances of class 'A' by virtue of residing on the same element
